fields.description:
If user clones via Hosted Repositories in SourceTree, the URL for the repository won't appear correct:

!bbserver.JPG|thumbnail!

Instead of it being a "https://localhost:7990", it appears as "https://localhost///git".

Cloning directly through Bitbucket Server works fine:

!bbserver2.JPG|thumbnail!


*Work Around*
Manually editing the URL to remove the extra "/" allows the uRL to be correctly identified as a git URL and it can the be cloned.
fields.summary: Cloning Bitbucket Server 4.0 repositories via Hosted Repositories is not possible due to error in the URL

fields.description:
Frequently, automatic encoding detection fails.
It occurs even if there is {{@charset "utf-8";}} at the top of a CSS file.
fields.summary: Automatic encoding detection fails

fields.description:
Blurry toolbar icons: !http://i.imgur.com/M3hSRFC.png!

Blurry sidebar icons: !http://i.imgur.com/7VS999h.png!
fields.summary: Toolbar and sidebar icons are blurry at 150% scaling (Surface Pro)

fields.description:
When working with submodule, it happens often to double click on one of them and jump to the associated tab. The operation open a new tab to show the submodule project or simply switch to it if already available. That's perfect.

When closing the submodule tab I would like to have the focus go back to the hoster project, which the submodule was open from. Now the focus moves on the left open tab.
fields.summary: When closing a submodule tab, switch back to source project

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1. Start SourceTree
2. Click Terminal button
=> crash occurs.

Attached file contains the last lines of the log. Second line says is "a file is not found"
fields.summary: Crash after clicking Terminal in SourceTree

fields.description:
I can't push. When I try, it shows the progress bar and keeps showing it forever. There are no errors when I reveal the full output.

When I do a simple {{git push}} on the commandline, it works absolutely fine. So something in sourcetree is broken, or it's not sending the correct commands to git.

I've set up ST to use system Git, which ST reports as version 2.5.1, which is correct as verified from the commandline.
fields.summary: Pushing doesn't work

fields.description: Add a way to quickly and only push the current checked out branch rather then unselect all the other branches and select the one which needs to be checked out when pushing from the UI.
fields.summary: Add a way to quickly and only push the current checked out branch.

fields.description:
Could you please support select text and copy text in the diff window. 
When I do a commit, I would like to copy text from the diff window into my commit description
fields.summary: Support select and copy in diff window

fields.description: I clicked the checkbox next to "Staged files" on the Uncommitted changes view before it finished loading.
fields.summary: Crash ArgumentNullException

fields.description:
Our binary files are not recognized and are previewed in the diff panel in SourceTree.

This can cause a slowdown when the file is large, and really, we don't want to encourage our SourceTree users to merge binary.

We are creating our binary files using System.IO's *"file.writeallbytes"* and storing it in a *".bytes"* file - Unity3D's recognised binary extension.

*Desired Outcome*

Either add .bytes to your internal 'is binary file' extension list. Or you could improve your binary detection algorithm to recognize these files.

Many Thanks,

Issue is Related to SRCTREEWIN-1119.
fields.summary: Disable auto-preview / merging of binary files

fields.description:
Commit information shows a link to parent with revision number. It would be useful to also see which branch the parent commit is in (see tortoise hg workbench).

This would be useful in determining which branch the current was branched from. At the moment it is difficult to see if there are many branches and/or some of them have commits over a long time. Choosing just current branch makes it easy to find the first commit but it is difficult to determine the branch of the parent with just the revision number.
fields.summary: Show parent branch in alongside parent revision

fields.description: if i try to create a pull request via right click on a branch and click "create pull request..." sourcetree crached with a "oops!" and closed ... log is added to this bug report...
fields.summary: Crash on create a pull request (GITHUB)

fields.description: While doing an interactive rebase, each time there's a merge conflict reported in the popup window and Close is selected, the rebase is aborted.
fields.summary: Merge conflict in interactive rebase always aborts the rebase operation

fields.description:
I have installed Git 2.5.2 64 bit and SourceTree cannot locate {code}ssh-add{code} executable anymore, so I can't add my OpenSSH key to the agent.

Previous version of Git I have been using (1.9.5) had {code}ssh-add{code} in the directory {code}bin{code} in Git's root directory. Version 2.5.2 has also directory {code}bin{code}, but it contains executables {code}bash{code}, {code}git{code} and {code}sh{code} only. {code}ssh-add{code} and other binaries are located in the directory {code}usr/bin{code}.

Temporary fix is to hardcode the right path to SourceTree's {code}openssh_add.cmd{code} script, but that won't work, if user switches to another Git of course.
fields.summary: "ssh-add" not found with Git 2.5.2

fields.description:
Hi, I was trying to clone a repository in bitbucket as advised by my manager. The clone was failed and the source tree app was crashed. I got a screen shot for the error message and it advised me to send the error message and log, so I am.

Thanks for looking into the issue.

Natarajan
fields.summary: Clone to sourcetree crahsed.

fields.description:
As of now we have the ability to use the history view to diff different commits. One just selects a commit, holds down the control or shift key and selects another.

The problem with branches and tags is that there is no support for this feature for them. If i left click a tag (in the sidebar) the commit is selected in the history, but if i hold down the control button and left click another tag, the commit from the first tag is deselected so that i cant see the changes.

Same issue is in the search View, if one wants to select two commits (by holding down ctrl or shift) that should be compared, the first one is always unselected.
fields.summary: Diff Tags/ Branches

fields.description:
点击命令行(click command)
软件奔溃(soft crash)
当系统还没有安装git的时候。（when the system didn't install the git)
fields.summary: crash

fields.description:
Moving a folder to any position, but if done when the cursor is really near the left border will cause the folder to disappear, and SourceTree will read that as user dragging the pointer trying to select a few bookmarks instead.

Note I've created a "New Folder", and trying to move it to the top:

!drag.jpg|thumbnail!


It disappeared instead:

!drop.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Moving a folder when the cursor is near the left border will result in a drag, and causing the folder to disappear.

fields.description: crashed on startup (happened after restart - and app became very slow and then I closed it)

fields.description: Started it, then changed windows, when returning to the SourceTree instance, i just gotr a crash report. Log included

fields.description: When clicking on a specific repo to commit, client crashes. Can be avoided if you delete the opentabs.xml file, but reoccurs if you select that tab again from within the client application.

fields.description:
Randomly, Source Tree is now crashing every time I right click anywhere on the menu.

This used to not be a problem, and it didn't time with the Windows 10 upgrade, and my other machine doesn't have this problem, but my main home computer does. Prevents me from using the program.
fields.summary: Crashes on right click

fields.description:
Sourcetree UI crashes on Windows 10 running on Virtualbox if the 'Enable 3D Acceleration' option is enabled.

It shows up in windows task manager then silently crashes.

Workaround: Disable 'Enable 3D Acceleration' option if running Sourcetree on Windows 10 on Virtualbox

fields.description:
When the uncommitted changes are viewed in either the File Status or the Log / History the divider between the files and the diff view is immovable. It is stuck just right of centre. One work around is to select the uncommitted changes and the previous commit and view the diff without the stage.

Switching to tree view will temporarily restore the divider to mobility. However it will reset itself right of centre again after selecting another commit and back (Log / History) or restarting SourceTree (File Status) and return to immobility.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes divider is immovable

Could you please trim the url of the origin repository?
fields.summary: Remote-Details: Spaces at the end of the URL / path are not trimmed

fields.description:
The current version of SourceTree does not perform well without connection to the remote repositories. While GIT works perfectly well locally, SourceTree is blocked by all the checks of the remotes it does.

An offline/local mode could solve this problems. If SourceTree is in this mode, no remotes are checked and all actions which would need a TCP connection are disabled.
fields.summary: Offline/Local Mode

fields.description:

Current branch is now default rather than the newly created branch

fields.description:
new Repository with same name of existing Folder removed Folder and all bookmarks inside.

reproduce:
create bookmark folder
add repositories to this bookmark folder
create new repository with the same name of the bookmark folder
-> bookmark folder is unfindable
-> repository is listed twice as bookmark


sorry, new way to reproduce:

the problem occurs when you have a folder and  a repository with the same name in another bookmark folder and you move the repository above the folder...

please see attached gif.
fields.summary: new Repository with same name of existing Folder removed Folder

fields.description:
After updating git to version 2.5.1, GitFlow does not work anymore. When trying to create a new feature, Sourcetree claims it's not a git repository but in fact it is.

Update: On 2.5.2, git checkout does not seem to work properly as well. SourceTree is giving an error every time you want to checkout a branch:

{code}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout code-comment
fatal: Unable to create 'F:/Code/Ruby/pullrequests/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.{code}
fields.summary: Sourcetree does not work properly after upgrading git to version 2.5.1/2.5.2

fields.description:
Often crashes on first startup but subsequent startups OK.

Has crashed when clicking on iconbar icon.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashing

fields.description:
When you have loads of Bookmarks like I do it can become quite visually cluttered and hard to digest to find the one you're looking to open. All that I really want to see is the Title of the Bookmark and the Folder Tree.

Not the second row of information on each bookmark - as all this info will be available to me in the awesome SourceTree environment as soon as I open the bookmark. Having a few bits of info represented by small green icons and number etc can just add to visual clutter, in my view.

I realize that there may be others with the opposite view to me, and if there are then it's why I suggest this become an option in the settings so users can choose which view they'd prefer. Tools->Option->General "Simple Bookmarks Tree" or "Advanced Bookmarks Tree"
fields.summary: New Bookmark Option Tools->Option->General "Simple Bookmarks Tree" or "Advanced Bookmarks Tree"

fields.description: SourceTree crashes when r-clicking on a project folder and selecting Copy Path to Clipboard.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash while Copy Path to Clipboard.

fields.description: It would be helpful to be able to apply a branch filter to the network view pane.  The filter could use regex or wildcards to match branch names .  So if I wanted to only display feature branches I could filter for "feature/*"
fields.summary: Network view branch filter

fields.description:
In the log / history for a Git project, you see each commit in a vertical select box.  Upon selecting a commit, you see the commit info.  One of the tabs in the commit info section is "Log / History", which shows the file(s) modified in that commit.

I think it would be very useful (especially for binary files) if this display showed the number of bytes modified.  So if a 100KB file was added, it would be 100KB.  If 50KB of that file was modified, it would show 50KB.  And if that 100KB file was deleted, it would show 100KB.

This obviously could apply to all files, but for me it would be most useful for binary files - it's nice to know at-a-glance how big a file (or modification) in a commit was.
fields.summary: Show size of files in log / history

fields.description:
When a user is working on a git repository and:
1. Clicks the Branch button 
2. Types in a branch name that start with "/" (ex: "/users/urig/some-feature")
3. Clicks the Create branch button.
Then he/she is presented with an error message saying:
{quote}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false branch /u
fatal: '/u' is not a valid branch name.
{quote}

My experience has shown that it's hard for novice users to deduce from this error message that removing the "/" will solve their problem.

I would suggest that SourceTree adds a bit of logic before sending the branch name to git that omits the erroneous "/" if it's present. That way the branch is created and the user is spared the error message.

Thanks for considering!
urig
fields.summary: Allow branch names that start with '/'

I want use suggested (default) mintty terminal in Git 2.5.1 for windows. It is better.

So now it is not possible and my workflow has problem with that.

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to "disconnect" certain remotes, so that a user can choose to fetch only from active remotes, rather than doing multiple, single-remote fetches manually.
fields.summary: Fetch from some remotes

fields.description:
In case of push, SourceTree verifies (correctly) if submodules have open changes in workspace that have not been staged. A warning message is shown (in a separate popup) that shows the submodules with dirty state.

But ST doesn't check if there are staged, but uncommitted changes in a submodule, although those changes make for a "dirty" subrepo state, just as unstaged ones. In both cases, the change has not yet been committed!
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't check if there are staged, but uncommitted changes in a submodule

fields.description:
Cannot clone a repository using SourceTree. Get a "This is not a valid source path / URL" error. These are the details: 
fatal:unable to access 'https://xxxxx@bitbucket.org/hrmwebdev/xxx.git/': Failed connect to bitbucket.org:443; No error.
fields.summary: Unable to pull code from repository

fields.description:
Cloned my first repo, tried to commit. Enter my name and e-mail address, receive a messagebox stating that the e-mail address is invalid. Change the name to anything else, and it gets accepted.

See attached capture.
fields.summary: Invalid e-mail address on first attempt

fields.description:
When a range of subsequent commits are selected. I.e. all on the same branch and no gaps. Allow cherry picking on the context menu.

This is presumably simple to implement because cherry picking a range is simple on command line.

git cherry-pick sha1..sha2
fields.summary: Cherry pick range of subsequent commits

fields.description:
If hotfix is created with a parenthesis:

!hotfix-name.JPG|thumbnail!

The hotfix could not be closed:

!hotfix-failed.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hotfix could not finish if there's parenthesis in the name.

fields.description: I started up SourceTree after a restart and got the "oops" error dialog which redirected me to the Kanban board.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed on startup

fields.description:
Right now you can right-click on a branch and select Pull Request - which starts a pull request of the current branch onto Master.  It would be nice to be able to have the pull request default  to the branch that you branched from - or to allow the user to set a default branch to do pull requests against.  This would save people an extra step (and time) when creating the pull request.

Our workflow is to do branch features and bugs from a release branch and then do pull requests onto that release branch.  When a release ships it gets merged into master.

Master
Bug/some_bug
Bug/another_bug
Feature/some_feature
Feature/another_feature
Release/current_release
Release/next_release
fields.summary: Add ability to set Branch for Pull Request

fields.description:
Client crashes when commit message field is selected (and expanded).

CANNOT COMMIT ANYTHING.
fields.summary: Client crashes when commit message field is selected (and expanded)

fields.description:
When right-clicking on a branch and clicking "Create pull request..." SourceTree consistently crashes every time.

Going to "Repository->Create pull request..." or using shortcut "Shift+Alt+P" also cause crash, but only after "Create Pull Request On Web->Close".
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when attempting to create pull request

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1. Start SourceTree
2. Click Terminal button
=> crash occurs.

Attached file contains the last lines of the log. Second line says is "a file is not found", but which is now missing?  

Not sure if it's related but getting "SSL Certificate problem: unable to get local issuer certificate" also when trying to clone a new repo or even push stuff to a existing one. Not sure if this could relate to the fact that I tried adding another email to my bitbucket account....
fields.summary: Crash after clicking Terminal in SourceTree

fields.description:
When I started SourceTree today I got this error message. It says it is embarrassed about the problem with SourceTree. The dialog provided is a better reason for being embarrassed if you ask me :). There is no "Report Bug" button as stated, the check-box is probably for something. The Show Details button toggles, but it only toggles the button-state, whereas the dialog contents otherwise stays the same.

I though the gray rectangle perhaps was the "Report Bug" button, but it doesn't seem to be the case. It is unresponsive too.

Just thought you wanted to know :)
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on startup, being embarrassed about it, but should be more embarrassed

fields.description:
Always seems to need several clicks to start. 
Eventually gets there.
Crashed on startup today. Log attached as requested

Could you add a button next to the icon functions to do a Refresh (F5) / Sync with Origin (Shift+Alt+R) so that a user can just click on it if he does not see his latest commits.

As a newbee, it took me a few days to find it after a few commits were done.

fields.description:
* Don't have any SSL certificates loaded in pageant, but have a repository that uses them
* Make a change. In my case I used Mercurial on Bitbucket
* Try pushing to the server.
* The missing SSL certificate error error gets reported not once, but three different times. The three different buttons are in very different locations, making the error annoying to clear.
!image1.png|thumbnail!
!image2.png|thumbnail!
!image3.png|thumbnail!

added exception log to this issue.

fields.description:
Using SourceTree windows application, with Git Flow style feature branches. After having done some development on a feature branch, and pushed it to origin, attempting to generate a pull request to have it reviewed.

Right click on feature branch. Click on "Create pull request...". Crashes. Bug reporter comes up.

Expected behaviour: Open suitable link in Google Chrome to generate a pull request.

Filter or Show/Hide branches in branches treeview

fields.description: Unexpected crash.  Log is attached.

fields.description:
Trying the option 'Create Pull Request' on a feature branch.  Immediate crash.  

Feature branch exists in both local and origin repos (local was cloned with tracking from origin branch).  Made a single change to a string in a java file (i.e. just doing some testing).

I've tried it with a couple of things, but they all die immediately on choosing 'Create pull request...':  Log looks the same on all of them.
- Uncommitted local change.
- Committed local change.
- change pushed to origin

From log, this info:

2015-08-26T09:46:15: Fatal error: 
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

2015-08-26T09:46:15: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.Repo.RepoHelper.CreatePullRequest(Repository repo, RepositoryRemoteProjectLink link, String remoteBranch, String commitSHA) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin\Repo\RepoHelper.cs:line 843

   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)

fields.description:
Sometime Sourcetree refreshes the view (probably caused by I/O operations). The selected commit becomes unselected.

That's really annoying if you scrolled down to a commit deep in the past.
fields.summary: Log / History: Selected commit loses focus

fields.description: In the file explorer you can choose to 'show in explorer'. I would like to be able to configure a different explorer (for me: FreeCommander) to show this in, instead of the default Windows Explorer.
fields.summary: Customize explorer application for 'show in explorer'

fields.description: While I have no functional issues when using Git 2.5.0 from SourceTree, the terminal opened (bin/bash.exe) is just a compatibility version. I have no choice to switch to git-bash.exe (mintty), which is much better with regards to resizing the window to full screen width, for example. I would like ST to open git-bash.exe, at least optionally. I even think it should be the default.
fields.summary: Use mintty terminal with Git 2.5.0
Crash on start Windows 10

fields.description:
I'm fairly new to SourceTree, however I've been changing code in a certain source code branch where 13 classes were changed do to one issue within a new project we're doing.

I now need to re-apply the changes again on a different branch (live).  And I'm unable to simply "push" to the other branch as the code base I've been working against is about 3 months out of date and other developers would have been working on the current version - so I can't simply "push" to the live code as I may overwrite or lose functionality that they have done.

What would be nice is a feature where I can print all the changes compared to the current branch I'm looking at - essentially the ability to print and/or export into a text file the "Stage Hunk" snippets for all the files that have changed so I have a clear single point to refer to for the changes once the current work has been committed.
fields.summary: DUPLICATE ENTRY: Ability to print & export staged hunks for all files with changes - look for: 3658

fields.description:
I'm fairly new to SourceTree, however I've been changing code in a certain source code branch where 13 classes were changed do to one issue within a new project we're doing.

I now need to re-apply the changes again on a different branch (live).  And I'm unable to simply "push" to the other branch as the code base I've been working against is about 3 months out of date and other developers would have been working on the current version - so I can't simply "push" to the live code as I may overwrite or lose functionality that they have done.

What would be nice is a feature where I can print all the changes compared to the current branch I'm looking at - essentially the ability to print and/or export into a text file the "Stage Hunk" snippets for all the files that have changed so I have a clear single point to refer to for the changes once the current work has been committed.
fields.summary: Ability to print & export staged hunks for all files with changes

fields.description:
I often need to pull or just fetch all changes under all the repositories I've linked with origin. I'd be nice to be able to do it all at once and avoid checking out and pull for every local branch I have.

Excellent app!
fields.summary: Git - Pull/Fecth all from origin

fields.description:
If an empty git repository os cloned and one tries to use the gitflow dialog, an error that the master branch does not exist will appear. Creating a master branch using the "branch" menu, of course fails with "fatal: Not a valid object name: 'master'." 

However using the command line, entering "git flow init" works perfectly. The git flow dialog should do the same as its command line counter part.
fields.summary: Git flow dialog does not work on empty git repository
